content:
BigCommerce’s mission is to help merchants sell more at every stage of growth, from small startups, to mid-market businesses to large enterprises. We focus on being the best ecommerce platform so our customers can focus on what matters most: growing their businesses.
We are equally passionate about growing our employee’s careers and providing them an incredible experience as we rapidly expand across the globe. We are proud to have been recognized numerous times for our product and workplace culture. We empower our people and customers to build, innovate and grow, so together we can redefine the ecommerce industry.Senior Director, Business Technology is a senior leader who proactively consults with key stakeholders across the organization to improve business IT infrastructure (Corporate network, Corporate Security, Endpoint Engineering & Mgmt), Business applications specifically including but not limited to:  Workday and other HRIS systems,  Salesforce, Zoura, Intacct, Workday financial and other back office systems,  AWS (integration), and Partner platforms.  This also includes DevOps tools (Jira, Github, Atlassian, etc) for FDX, BC, and future acquisitions.  As part of our Operations team, you’ll instill an innovative, agile mindset within our IT and Business Applications organization, striking the right balance of agility, urgency process, and structure. An expert communicator and technologist, you hold your teams to high standards and inspire each individual to excel in ways that add value to the business and our clients.
**To be considered an applicant you must reside in the United States**
What You Will Do

As part of the CIO organization, you will partner with the leadership team; understand the company’s vision; and support the development and alignment of IT strategies for future growth, with an emphasis on planning for BigCommerce’s growth and future organizational needs
Partner with the Transformation leadership team in the implementation and development processes for our GTM (Sales, Marketing, and Support), Financial Operations (Accounting and FP&A), HR organization, and Marketing (Web platform and Marketing automation tools) organizations
Build and maintain strong relationships with P&E leadership and collaborate with P&E team to design a future state integration approach between the business applications and product platform functionality (BMP)
Mentor and develop a management layer to set up our business expansions for success.  Ensure there is a development plan for each employee within the IT/BizApps organization
Manage demand queue with business stakeholders to ensure priorities are aligned across the organization
Work closely with the Cyber & GRC teams to ensure security priorities are embedded in BC’s design and development practices and advocate for security, GRC, and SOX prioritization in the business technology initiatives
Continuously improve IT processes across the Company; improve functionality and eliminate redundancies
Strong financial acumen and discipline, understanding technology spend working with FP&A representation
Collaborate with strategic procurement to identify opportunities to reduce redundancies across FDX, BC and future acquisitions
Communicate and integrate company-wide technology standards, applications and infrastructure
Excluding Transformation initiatives, this role is responsible to evaluate and select technology in partnership with business stakeholders, develop, and implement new technology as needed to support the company
Partner with the Enterprise architect and Data solution leadership to ensure business technology ecosystem is cohesive, agile, and scalable to support the evolving needs of the business
Strong experience with M&A due diligence and integration planning from a technology perspective
Ensure compliance with corporate policies and standards, as well as Data Privacy and Information security laws and regulations, aimed at maximizing effectiveness and minimizing costs related to the acquisition, implementation, and operation of IT systems
Provide focused, business-minded IT leadership, emphasizing IT’s measurable contribution to business success and business metrics (revenue growth, profitability, customer service, expense, etc.)
Analyze and identify security risks; develop solutions aimed at improving information security capabilities
Maintain security of all proprietary data; provide complete backup of all computer systems in case of system failure or disaster
Balance internal and external IT members and resources

Who You Are

15 + years of progressive IT experience in a fast-paced, high-growth business with global hands-on knowledge
Experience successfully supporting and scaling enterprise sales organization and customer support centers required. Extensive enterprise business application software (ie Salesforce, Workday, Zoura, Sage/Intacct, Nexonia, Bill.com) experience is a must
Experience integrating the various IT platforms of acquired companies into a cohesive unified system; synergizing a multi-site and global IT platform
Experience implementing and integrating Enterprise Applications
Experience with network design, configuration, installation, maintenance, support and troubleshooting
Direct experience with IT planning and budget management
Excellent communication; ability to gain the confidence of senior executive audiences or higher.
Ability to evolve with a rapidly changing environment, make decisions, prioritize, and meet or exceed deadlines.
Maintains knowledge of current and emerging technologies.
Due to the global nature of the role, flexibility in work schedule; Ability to work variable extended hours may include extensive travel at times which can include evenings and/or weekends
Maintain a valid passport to travel overseas when required
Ambitious yet humble with a passion for leading and developing successful, high-performance teams

#LI-REMOTE
#LI-GC1
